poem:
Title: Torn Threads of Peace

The world wakes to another spasm of threat and fire,
a far-off storm brewing, two ministers teetering on departure.
Silent birds of war crash into the wine-dark Red Sea,
mere correspondences of chaos from the world's ceaseless loom.
No cries of hurt, no rain of rubble, yet peace seems
A mirage cloaked in the morning mist of the Middle East.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The Central Command forces also destroyed two Houthi anti-ship ballistic missiles fired in direction of the USS Gravely, it said. No injuries or damage were reported by". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
